results.title: The Sydney Gay and Lesbian Mardi Gras Parade
results.creator_credit: Susan Oliver, Stephen Jones and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: In 1994 the ABC chose to broadcast the annual Sydney Gay and Lesbian Mardi Gras Parade live on Australian television. The decision generated much controversy but the public broadcasting of the event allowed all Australians to witness the joy and imagination involved in what is now one of the world’s leading festivals. This video of the broadcast includes footage not shown on the original screening. The Mardi Gras is a street festival in which lesbians, gays, queers and deviants can celebrate their communities and their determination to not be hidden from the public face of Australian culture. The theme of the 1994 Mardi Gras was “We Are Family” which aptly defines the strength of the Australian gay and lesbian movements in forging new forms of communal relationships which are working to challenge and destabilise homophobia. Testament to the Parade’s success is its ability to bring almost a million people onto the streets of Sydney to join in the celebrations.

results.title: The Sydney Dance Company in Daphnis & Chloe
results.creator_credit: Charles Thompson, Independent Film Channel (US), Channel 4 Television Corporation and Jolyon Wimhurst
results.brief_description: The program opens with the choreographer, Graeme Murphy, discussing the origins of the work and how he changed it, illustrated with extracts from the performance which follows. The performance opens in a garden which is overseen by the God Pan. Innocent Daphnis falls for Chloe, but he has a rival, Dorcan the Herdsmen. They vie for her hand in a dance competition; the winner to receive a kiss.

results.title: The Sword of the lord
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Tom Daly, Desmond Dew and Giles Walker
results.brief_description: This film records the extraordinary determination of Jungle Jim Hunter to be the best ski racer in the world. We witness the gruelling exercise routines, the pre-race tensions, the descents, the disappointments and the deep religious faith of this most dedicated athlete. Photographed by Paul Cowan. Edited by John Laing. Music by Ben Low. Sound by Bev Davidson, Andre Galbrand.

results.title: The Sword and the Flower
results.creator_credit: Frank Heimans, Paul Rea and Cinetel Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Warriors”.
For some Australian ex-servicemen, wartime experiences have created permanent feelings of bitterness towards the Japanese. For others, like the men interviewed in this program, their contact with the Japanese led to a completely different attitude to war and their former enemies. Those interviewed include Norman Sparnon, ex-Major in Australian Army Intelligence who served as an interpreter in New Guinea and post-war Japan, George Beard who recalls his experiences in a Japanese POW camp in Thailand, Gordon Parker and Alan Pedder who both returned with war brides from Japan, Stephen Kelen, the only Australian soldier in Hiroshima on the first anniversary of the Bomb and Kenneth Wybrow, a barrister who assists the mixed-blood children left behind in Japan by Australian servicemen.

results.title: The Sword
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
A bird is born on a farm. Once grown, an evil farmer tries to shoot it as he is flying to the sun. Dying, this bird grows to monster proportions and is killed in his tracks by a man who finds a golden sword in the park.

results.title: The Switchboard operator = Ljubavni Slucaj, trafedija sluzbenice PTT
results.brief_description: Makavejev’s second feature tells the story of a love affair between Izabela, a liberated young woman from the Hungarian minority in Yugoslavia, and the more conventional Ahmed, who is a member of the Moslem community. Gradually their cultural differences become a source of conflict. Rather than telling their story through a linear narrative, Makavejev introduces apparently extraneous documentary elements, building up a complex and richly allusive collage of a society undergoing a process of rapid and bewildering social change. The film provides an insight into the internal tensions which contributed to the eventual break-up of the former Yugoslavia. In Serbo-Croatian language with English subtitles.

results.title: The Swirling seas
results.creator_credit: John Selwyn Gilbert, Channel Four, Antelope Films and Network Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Spaceship Earth”.
It’s hopeful that views from space can help human beings to better understand the oceans, and to care for them more wisely than has happened with land resources. Satellites have transformed the human view of the world’s oceans and coastal seas. Maps which took centuries of seagoing observations to compile are now being superceded by a constant stream of space data.

results.title: The Swineherd (K)
results.creator_credit: Paul Hammerich, Weston Woods Studios and Gene Deitch
results.brief_description: A spoiled princess scorns the love of a worthy prince yet will kiss a swineherd a hundred times for a silly musical toy. An adaptation of the Hans Christian Andersen story that uses original illustrations from the book by Bjorn Wiinblad. Interesting animation by Gene Deitch with touches of irony in narration. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.
